pullRequest.title: MLT writer perf improvements
pullRequest.bodyText:
Another set of changes which are results of running the spring-petclinic benchmark and observing the collected profiles.

the biggest win is the thread-local pooling of ByteBuffer which brings down the observed allocation rate from >4GiB/s to ~400MiB/s
another 'free' improvement is realization that I used 'array' based fastutil maps and sets and this made each and every lookup insanely expensive; changing to hash-based version brings ~10x speedup in the stack sampling routine
another change is rather marginal - I was experimenting with completely disabling the sub-tree deduplication and it seems like the collected data size is almost unaffected while the perf is slightly (<5%) improved; the default behaviour is not to attempt sub-tree deduplication but can be changed by setting the system property mlt.subtree_compression to true (for benchmarking/testing purposes mostly)

commit.message: Allow to completely omit the stacktrace subtree deduplication
Allow temporarily adjust sampler period via a system property
Allow passing in a processor closure instead of passing over an IMLTChunk instance
Improve allocation behaviour by pooling ByteBuffer at thread level

nodes.bodyText: I suspect this branch will probably lead to much better compression opportunities than the other.

MLTReader class does not have any fields so we may make all methods static.
usually when you are doing something like:
new MyClass().aMethod()
you can transform your method as a static one as don't have to store any fields inside the object

commit.message: Use (potentially) more performant checks instead of bit-masks

beforeCommit.message: An attempt to fix IBM8 CI tests
